DataElement.preferredName: Concomitant Medication Administered Dosage Unit of Measure Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: All codes that represent dosage units of  the concomitant medication administered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the concomitant medication administered.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Concomitant; following as a consequence.:biologically active substance, including those intended for use in diagnosis, treatment, or prevention of disease or other abnormalities, for the relief of suffering, or control or improvement of a physical or mental state; includes biological products.

Concepts.definition: Accessory, accompanying especially in a subordinate or incidental way, occurring or existing during the same period of time.

A drug product that contains one or more active and/or inactive ingredients; it is intended to treat, prevent or alleviate the symptoms of disease. This term does not refer to the individual ingredients that make up the product.
The act of having given something (e.g., a medication or test).

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: All codes that represent dosage units of measure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A basic SI unit of mass. It is defined as the mass of an international prototype in the form of a platinum-iridium cylinder kept at Sevres in France. A kilogram is equal to 1,000 grams and 2.204 622 6 pounds.

Concepts.definition: A basic SI unit of mass. It is defined as the mass of an international prototype in the form of a platinum-iridium cylinder kept at Sevres in France. A kilogram is equal to 1,000 grams and 2.204 622 6 pounds.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one one thousandth of a kilogram.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a kilogram. One gram equals approximately 15.432 grains or 0.035 273 966 ounce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one thousandth of a gram or 1000 micrograms. One milligram equals approximately 0.015 432 grain or 35.274 x 10E-6 ounce.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of mass equal to one millionth of a gram or one thousandth of a milligram.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The metric unit of mass equal to one billionth of a gram (10E-9 gram) or one thousandth of a milligram.

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of mass equal to one billionth of a gram (10E-9 gram) or one thousandth of a milligram.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The metric unit of mass equal to one trillionth of a gram (10E-12 gram).

Concepts.definition: The metric unit of mass equal to one trillionth of a gram (10E-12 gram).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of milligrams of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of milligrams of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of micrograms of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A unit of a mass fraction expressed as a number of micrograms of substance per kilogram of mixture. The unit is also used as a dose calculation unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-5 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-5 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-8 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

Concepts.definition: A metric unit of areal density equal to approximately 2.94935E-8 ounce per square yard. Also used as a dose calculation unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches.

Concepts.definition: The non-SI unit of volume accepted for use with the SI. One liter is equal to cubic decimeter, or one thousandth of cubic meter, or 1000 cubic centimeters, or approximately 61.023 744 cubic inches.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A metric unit of volume equal to one millionth of a liter or one one thousandth of a milliliter.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume accepted for use with the SI and equal to one millionth of a liter (10E-6 liter).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A SI derived unit of activity of a radionuclide, equal to one nuclear disintegration or other nuclear transition from a particular energy state occurring in an amount of a radionuclide during one second-long time interval.

Concepts.definition: A SI derived unit of activity of a radionuclide, equal to one nuclear disintegration or other nuclear transition from a particular energy state occurring in an amount of a radionuclide during one second-long time interval.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radioactivity equal to 10E9 nuclear disintegrations or other nuclear transformations per second, or to 10E9 becquerels.

Concepts.definition: A unit of radioactivity equal to 10E9 nuclear disintegrations or other nuclear transformations per second, or to 10E9 becquerels.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radioactivity equal to 10E6 nuclear disintegrations or other nuclear transformations per second, or to 10E6 becquerels.

Concepts.definition: A unit of radioactivity equal to 10E6 nuclear disintegrations or other nuclear transformations per second, or to 10E6 becquerels.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radioactivity equal to 10E3 nuclear disintegrations or other nuclear transformations per second, or to 10E3 becquerels.

Concepts.definition: A unit of radioactivity equal to 10E3 nuclear disintegrations or other nuclear transformations per second, or to 10E3 becquerels.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radioactivity in the CGS system, defined as 3.7 E10 atomic disintegrations or other nuclear transformations per second. One curie is equal to 37 gigabecquerels.

Concepts.definition: A unit of radioactivity in the CGS system, defined as 3.7 E10 atomic disintegrations or other nuclear transformations per second. One curie is equal to 37 gigabecquerels.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one thousandth of a curie or 37 megabecquerels, and corresponding to a radioactivity of 37 millions of atomic disintegrations per second.

Concepts.definition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one thousandth of a curie or 37 megabecquerels, and corresponding to a radioactivity of 37 millions of atomic disintegrations per second.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one millionth of a curie or 37 kilobecquerels, and corresponding to a radioactivity of 37 000 atomic disintegrations per second.

Concepts.definition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one millionth of a curie or 37 kilobecquerels, and corresponding to a radioactivity of 37 000 atomic disintegrations per second.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one billionth of a curie or 37 becquerels, and corresponding to radioactivity of 37 atomic disintegrations per second.

Concepts.definition: A unit of radioactivity equal to one billionth of a curie or 37 becquerels, and corresponding to radioactivity of 37 atomic disintegrations per second.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of amount of substance, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). It is the amount of substance that contains as many elementary units as there are atoms in 0.012 kg of carbon-12. When the mole is used, the elementary entities must be specified and may be atoms, molecules, ions, electrons, other particles, or specified groups of such particles.

Concepts.definition: A unit of amount of substance, one of the seven base units of the International System of Units (Systeme International d'Unites, SI). It is the amount of substance that contains as many elementary units as there are atoms in 0.012 kg of carbon-12. When the mole is used, the elementary entities must be specified and may be atoms, molecules, ions, electrons, other particles, or specified groups of such particles.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of amount of substance equal to 0.001 mole.

Concepts.definition: A unit of amount of substance equal to 0.001 mole.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of amount of substance equal to a millionth of a mole.

Concepts.definition: A unit of amount of substance equal to a millionth of a mole.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The unitage assigned by the WHO to International Biological Standards - substances, classed as biological according to the criteria provided by WHO Expert Committee on Biological Standardization (e.g. hormones, enzymes, and vaccines), to enable the results of biological and immunological assay procedures to be expressed in the same way throughout the world. The definition of an international unit is generally arbitrary and technical, and has to be officially approved by the International Conference for Unification of Formulae.

Concepts.definition: The unitage assigned by the WHO to International Biological Standards - substances, classed as biological according to the criteria provided by WHO Expert Committee on Biological Standardization (e.g. hormones, enzymes, and vaccines), to enable the results of biological and immunological assay procedures to be expressed in the same way throughout the world. The definition of an international unit is generally arbitrary and technical, and has to be officially approved by the International Conference for Unification of Formulae.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit equal to one thousand international units.

Concepts.definition: A unit equal to one thousand international units.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit equal to one-thousandth of an international unit.

Concepts.definition: A unit equal to one-thousandth of an international unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of measure of a quantity of substance per unit mass, expressed as the quantity of substance in International Units, divided by the mass of the substance in kilograms. It is also used as a dose calculation unit expressed in International Units of biological activity per one kilogram of body mass.

Concepts.definition: A unit of measure of a quantity of substance per unit mass, expressed as the quantity of substance in International Units, divided by the mass of the substance in kilograms. It is also used as a dose calculation unit expressed in International Units of biological activity per one kilogram of body mass.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of relative amount of a substance equal to one thousandth of an equivalent weight.

Concepts.definition: A unit of relative amount of a substance equal to one thousandth of an equivalent weight.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of volume used in pharmacy and equal to 0.05 milliliter (20 drops/ml).

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume used in pharmacy and equal to 0.05 milliliter (20 drops/ml).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-SI unit of mass equal to 1/16 Avoirdupois ounce or 1/256 Avoirdupois pound. One dram equals approximately 1.7718451953125 grams.

Concepts.definition: The non-SI unit of mass equal to 1/16 Avoirdupois ounce or 1/256 Avoirdupois pound. One dram equals approximately 1.7718451953125 grams.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

Concepts.definition: A unit for expressing a number as a fraction of hundred (on the basis of a rate or proportion per hundred).

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Not known, not observed, not recorded, or refused.

Concepts.definition: Not known, observed, recorded; or reported as unknown by the data contributor.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

Concepts.definition: Different than the one(s) previously specified or mentioned.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid contained within either a hard or soft soluble shell, usually prepared from gelatin.

Concepts.definition: A solid contained within either a hard or soft soluble shell, usually prepared from gelatin.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A solid dosage form containing medicinal substances with or without suitable diluents.

Concepts.definition: A solid composed of a mixture of that active and/or inert ingredient(s) are pressed or compacted together, usually in the form of a relatively flat and round, square or oval shape.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit that contains medicinal substances in the form similar to a tablet enclosed within a tamper-resistant soluble container usually made from a suitable form of gelatin.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a caplet.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of radiant exposure equal to radiant energy of one joule arriving upon a surface area of one square centimeter. The unit is also used for measurement of output of the energy-emitting source.

Concepts.definition: A unit of radiant exposure equal to radiant energy of one joule arriving upon a surface area of one square centimeter. The unit is also used for measurement of output of the energy-emitting source.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Packaging of medication in individual servings.

Concepts.definition: Packaging of medication in individual servings.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing measurement based on the application unit.

Concepts.definition: A dosing measurement based on the application unit.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of volume used in pharmacy and equal to 5 milliliters.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume used in pharmacy and equal to 5 milliliters.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A unit of volume informally used in pharmacy. Under the metric system the tablespoon has been standardized at 15 milliliters in the US, Britain, Canada, and New Zealand, and at 20 milliliters in Australia and some European countries.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume informally used in pharmacy. Under the metric system the tablespoon has been standardized at 15 milliliters in the US, Britain, Canada, and New Zealand, and at 20 milliliters in Australia and some European countries.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit equal to a metered dose of medicinal substance(s) that is delivered in uniform quantity upon each activation of a medical device (e.g. an inhaler), in which the dosage form is contained.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a puff.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A dosing unit that contains a solid pharmaceutical preparation in the form of a small packet or bag made from a flexible, often porous material.

Concepts.definition: A dosing unit equal to the amount of active ingredient(s) contained in a sachet.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A measure of volume for a liquid.  A milliliter is approximately 950 times smaller than a quart and 30 times smaller than a fluid ounce.  A milliliter of liquid and a cubic centimeter (cc) of liquid are the same.

Concepts.definition: A unit of volume equal to one millionth (10E-6) of a cubic meter, one thousandth of a liter, one cubic centimeter, or 0.061023 7 cubic inch. A cubic centimeter is the CGS unit of volume.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the units of measure for assessment results and dosing.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

Concepts.definition: A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

ValueDomain.administrativeNotes: 2023.8.23 Updated fes for 'No Vale Exists' and supplied missing concepts. ak

ReferenceDocuments.description: Prior and Concomitant Medication Dose Unit
